channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: ABCニュース、元GMAプロデューサーのカースティン・クロフォードが、上司マイケル・コーンに対するセクハラ疑惑を無視したと訴えた訴訟で和解（Winston Cho/Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Winston Cho / Hollywood Reporter:
ABC News settles former GMA producer Kirstyn Crawford's lawsuit that accused the network of ignoring sexual harassment allegations against her boss Michael Corn  —  The lawsuit from Kirstyn Crawford accused the network of ignoring sexual harassment allegations against then news executive Michael Corn.

item.title: LinkedInのニュースルームは、30カ国、17言語に250人の編集者とライターを擁し、他のプラットフォームが撤退する中、ニュースへの取り組みを倍増させている（Jim Edwards/Press Gazette）。
item.description:
Jim Edwards / Press Gazette:
A look at LinkedIn's newsroom, which has 250 editors and writers across 30 countries and 17 languages, as the platform doubles down on news as others pull back  —  Linkedin's editor-in-chief Daniel Roth explains how the platform is prioritising and promoting news.

item.title: ネットフリックスは、ケニアで25％の番組と映画を提供していたモバイル無料層を11月1日に2年で終了し、月額～6ドルの広告層を展開する予定（Duncan Miriri/Reuters）
item.description:
Duncan Miriri / Reuters:
Netflix plans to end its free mobile tier in Kenya, which offered 25% of its shows and movies, after two years on November 1, and rolls out a ~$6/month ad tier  —  Netflix (NFLX.O) said on Monday it is ending its free mobile plan in Kenya, which has allowed users to access a quarter of its shows …

item.title: スポティファイ、インドで無料層に試聴制限を追加し、有料契約を促進；インドはスポティファイのMAU数で上位5市場の1つだが、収益では上位に入らない（Amit Gurbaxani/Music Ally）
item.description:
Amit Gurbaxani / Music Ally:
Spotify adds listening restrictions to its free tier in India to drive paid subscriptions; India is one of Spotify's top five markets by MAUs but not by revenue  —  Nearly five years after it launched in India, Spotify is adding a layer of restrictions for its free users there.

item.title: 調査：2023年初め、ベトナムはX投稿を通じて、米下院議員、CNN記者、米政策専門家の携帯電話にプレデター・スパイウェアを仕込もうとした（ワシントン・ポスト紙）
item.description:
Washington Post:
Investigation: earlier in 2023, Vietnam tried to plant Predator spyware on the phones of US Congress members, CNN journalists, and US policy experts via X posts  —  The attempts appear to have been unsuccessful, but came as the U.S. and Vietnam were negotiating an agreement that President Biden signed last month in Hanoi

Wall Street Journal:

item.title: ポッドキャストをアップルのポッドキャスト・チャートの上位に押し上げるため、ポッドキャストのダウンロード数を人為的に増加させる家内制手工業について（Max Tani/Semafor）
item.description:
Max Tani / Semafor:
A look at the cottage industry around artificially boosting podcast download numbers, in order to push podcasts to the top of Apple's podcast charts and more  —  The News  —  Earlier this year, PJ Vogt received a strange proposition: If he paid a few dollars to a small self-described media buying company …

item.title: ユーザーによる音楽データベースであり、物理的な音楽メディアのマーケットプレイスであるDiscogsについて。
item.description:
Natalie Weiner / The Verge:
A look at Discogs, a user-generated music database and marketplace for physical music media, as sellers complain about the website's old tech and increased fees  —  A home for music diehards has been fractured by increased fees that are pushing sellers and shoppers to other platforms.

item.title: Scope3：デジタル広告が生み出すCO2排出量は年間720万トンで、これは米国の一般家庭140万戸分の電気使用量に相当する（Tim McDonnell/Semafor）
item.description:
Tim McDonnell / Semafor:
Advertisers face growing pressure to cut their emissions; Scope3: digital ads create ~7.2M tons of CO2 annually, equivalent to 1.4M US homes' electricity usage  —  The News  —  Of all the sectors under pressure to cut their carbon footprint, advertising has largely flown under the radar.

item.title: インディペンデンス・パブリック・メディア財団のモリー・デ・アギアー理事長とのQ&A：地元メディアの資金提供者と国の資金提供者との間にしばしば生じる断絶などについて（Richard J. Tofel/Second Rough Draft）
item.description:
Richard J. Tofel / Second Rough Draft:
Q&A with Independence Public Media Foundation President Molly de Aguiar on the frequent disconnect between local media funders and national funders, and more  —  Molly de Aguiar on a key goal of plans like Press Forward … Q. I think we agree that the only way to really sustainably achieve …

item.title: フランスの日曜紙「ラ・トリビューヌ・ディマンシュ」創刊の様子。唯一の日曜紙「ル・ジャーナル・デュ・ディマンシュ」が極右新聞に変貌する中（Angelique Chrisafis/The Guardian）
item.description:
Angelique Chrisafis / The Guardian:
A look at the launch of the French Sunday newspaper La Tribune Dimanche, as the only other Sunday paper, Le Journal du Dimanche, turns into a far-right outlet  —  La Tribune Dimanche goes on sale in landscape of declining print sales, culture wars and scrutiny of billionaire proprietors

item.title: 情報源フロリダ政治』創刊者ピーター・ショーシュ氏、政治家に無記名記事を買わせ、広告を買う政治キャンペーンの意向で報道を歪曲（NPR）
item.description:
NPR:
Sources: Florida Politics founder Peter Schorsch lets politicians buy unlabeled stories and distorts coverage at the behest of political campaigns that buy ads  —  This story was reported by NPR's David Folkenflik and Miranda Green of Floodlight, a nonprofit newsroom that investigates the powerful interests stalling climate action.

item.title: アレクサは2020年のアメリカ大統領選挙が盗まれたと主張し、信頼できないランブルとサブスタックの情報源を引用していたが、アマゾンは誤りを修正したと述べている（Cat Zakrzewski/Washington Post）
item.description:
Cat Zakrzewski / Washington Post:
Alexa has been claiming that the US 2020 presidential election was stolen, citing unvetted Rumble and Substack sources; Amazon says the errors have been fixed  —  The popular voice assistant says the 2020 race was stolen, even as parent company Amazon promotes the tool as a reliable election news source …

item.title: ニューヨーク・パブリック・ラジオが20人のスタッフを解雇、スタジオ部門から2つのポッドキャストをカット。
item.description:
Max Rivlin-Nadler / hellgatenyc:
New York Public Radio lays off 20 staff members and cuts two podcasts from its studio division; three more employees took union-negotiated voluntary buyouts  —  “It is not a good use of any of our time, looking in the rearview mirror and trying to figure out where we should place blame,” …

item.title: BBCはOpenAIとCommon Crawlによるデータのスクレイピングをブロックしているが、研究、制作、パーソナライズされた体験のためのジェネレーティブAIの利用を模索する計画だ（Emilia David/The Verge）
item.description:
Emilia David / The Verge:
The BBC blocks OpenAI and Common Crawl from scraping its data, but plans to explore using generative AI for research, production, and personalized experiences  —  The BBC, the UK's largest news organization, laid out principles it plans to follow as it evaluates the use of generative AI …
